column4: hi everybody! after the upgrade, ubuntu is not recognizing my video card and running in low-graphics mode. the video adapter is "VGA compatible controller: Silicon Integrated Systems [SiS] 771/671 PCIE VGA Display Adapter. Please somebody suggest smth
Try the vesa video driver? if not anything else, just to start X
thanks, I'll try to find it now )
Using gnome, you can disable compiz by starting gnome's default window manager with 'metacity --replace'
What are you trying to accomplish here?
It was me
cant start my X, was playing around with compiz, and now I get a black screen with the mouse pointer in the middle
how can I disable compiz, and maybe some themes, from the recovery-mode terminal? )
Jusr chmod -x it and then run metacity when you get X up (assuming compiz is causing some kind of problem for you)
but I have already removed compiz by apt-get remove ) is that okay?
Sure, but I still don't know what you're ultimately trying to accomplish here
Do your windows even have borders?
Start 'metacity --replace'
oh, good idea :) let me try it..
Probably not. If you can open gconf-editor, navigate to desktop>gnome>session>required_components>windowmanager and make sure it is set to metacity
sec
and another stupid question.. where do I open gconf-editor? :)
From Alt+F2
thanks :)
thank you so much! appreciate!!
Not sure, did you fix whatever it was you were trying to?
Ask in #windows
